items.sentence: The police have their reasons for suspecting Tom.
Neither Tom nor Mary has trouble speaking French.
Neither Tom nor Mary has to do anything else now.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been very busy recently.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been sick for very long.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been here for very long.
Tom is a new student. Mary is a new student, too.
Tom was the one who told me he wanted to do that.
Things just haven't been the same since you left.
I forgot to mail the letter you asked me to mail.
Tom wasn't the first one to turn his homework in.
Tom and Mary, you two partner up with each other.
A lot of my friends can speak French really well.
I think that a lot of people will be there today.
Melt the chocolate, add the butter and stir well.
Are you going to throw yourself a birthday party?
We have a yacht, two helicopters, and a seaplane.
I don't know how long this traffic jam will last.
The ice cream that I ate yesterday was delicious.
That restaurant has a lot of green wooden tables.
I can't keep up with everything that's happening.
Tom told me he thought Mary was back from Boston.
Tom said that he thought Mary was good at French.
Tom said that he thought that Mary taught French.
Tom said he'd visit Mary in Boston every weekend.
I suspect that Tom and Mary are in Australia now.
I told Tom that I would go to Australia with him.
The last time I went to Australia, I visited Tom.
It's good you were able to go to Boston with Tom.
The first person that I met in Australia was Tom.
Can you remember the first time that you met Tom?
Can you remember the first time that you saw Tom?
I thought you said Tom used to live in Australia.
I thought you'd want to go to Australia with Tom.
I think that I'd better go to Australia with Tom.
I suppose you want to live in Australia with Tom.
I suggest you go to Australia with Tom next week.
I promised Tom that I'd go to Australia with him.
I hope you and Tom have a good time in Australia.
I hope that Tom didn't go to Australia with Mary.
Tom has told me that he wants to go to Australia.
Tom has told me that he needs to go to Australia.
I didn't know that Tom used to live in Australia.
I didn't know that Tom used to work in Australia.
How did you learn Tom wasn't living in Australia?
How did Tom know that Mary would be in Australia?
Would it be OK if I didn't go to school tomorrow?
What are the most popular sports in your country?
I suggest that you give your old computer to Tom.
I still think that we should've told Tom to come.
